column1: Quote
'Now we are all sons-of-bitches.'
column2: Kenneth Tompkins Bainbridge on July 16, 1945, after the detonation of the first atomic bomb, 'The Gadget' (Attributed to Robert Oppenheimer)

column1: 'Never in the field of human conflict, has so much, been owed by so many, to so few!'
'In twelve years from now, you will not recognize Berlin.'
'The assertion that it is the intention of the German Reich to coerce the Austrian State is absurd.'
'My Luftwaffe is invincible...And so now we turn to England. How long will this one last - two, three weeks?'
'A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs who, however, has never learned how to walk forward.'
'Who controls the past controls the future. Who controls the present controls the past.'
'This war is not an ordinary war. It is the war of the entire Russian people.'
'Before we're through with them, the Japanese language will be spoken only in hell!'
'Hell is on us.'
'Defend Paris to the last, destroy all bridges over the Seine and devastate the city.'
'I saw my enemies in Munich, and they are worms.'
'Why should this war in the West be fought for the restoration of Poland? The Poland of the Versailles Treaty will never rise again.'
'Germany must either be a world power or there will be no Germany.'
'Which would your men rather be, tired, or dead?'
'I have seen war...I hate war.'
'Force is the only language they understand, like bullies.'
'If we have power, we'll never give it up again unless we're carried out of our offices as corpses.'
'Do you want a total war?'
'It is evil things we shall be fighting against, brute force, bad faith, injustice, oppression and persecution.'
'Without ships, we cannot live.'
'Any alliance whose purpose is not the intention to wage war is senseless and useless.'
'In a time of war, the law falls silent.'
'Logistics is the ball and chain of armored warfare.'
'Anyone who sees and paints a sky green and fields blue ought to be sterilized.'
'You may not be interested in war, but war is interested in you.'
'In war, truth is the first casualty.'
'All wars will be settled by sea power.'
'It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.'
'Demoralize the enemy from within by surprise, terror, sabotage, assassination. This is the war of the future.'
'How fortunate for governments that the people they administer don't think.'
'My motto is 'Destroy him by all and any means.' I am the one who will wage the war!'
'I do not see why man should not be just as cruel as nature.'
'If today I stand here as a revolutionary, it is as a revolutionary against the Revolution.'
'All warfare is based on deception.'
'In the eyes of empire builders men are not men but instruments.'
'Never do an enemy a small injury.'
'I use emotion for the many and reserve reason for the few.'
'The supreme excellence is to subdue the armies of your enemies without even having to fight them...'
'If you tell a big enough lie and tell it frequently enough, it will be believed.'
'Who says I am not under the special protection of God?'
'The victor will never be asked if he told the truth.'
'The great strength of the totalitarian state is that it forces those who fear it to imitate it.'
'Whoever lights the torch of war in Europe can wish for nothing but chaos.'
'The statesman who yields to war fever... is no longer the master of policy but the slave of unforeseeable and uncontrollable events.'
'Then will come a National Socialist State tribunal, then will November, 1918, be expiated, then the heads will roll.'
'I believe that Providence would never have allowed us to see the victory of the Movement
column2: if it had the intention after all to destroy us at the end.' Adolf Hitler

column1: 'Wars teach us not to love our enemies, but to hate our allies.'
'I am beginning with the young. We older ones are used up. Yes, we are old already. We are cowardly and sentimental.'
'Politics is the womb in which war develops.'
'In the course of my life I have very often been a prophet, and have usually been ridiculed for it.'
'Life never forgives weaknesses.'
'There is nothing so likely to produce peace as to be well prepared to meet the enemy.'
'The world is a dangerous place, not because of those who do evil, but because of those who look on and do nothing.'
'I have not come into this world to make men better, but to make use of their weaknesses.'
'There is no glory in battle worth the blood it costs.'
'For the sake of historical truth I must verify that only the Greeks, of all the adversaries
column2: who confronted us, fought with bold courage and highest disregard of death.' Adolf Hitler

column1: 'Providence shows no mercy to weak nations, but recognizes the right of existence-only of sound and strong nations.'
'All nations want peace, but they want a peace that suits them.'
'I intend to set up a thousand-year Reich and anyone who supports me in this battle is a fellow-fighter for a unique divine creation.'
'The belief in the possibility of a short decisive war appears to be one of the most ancient and dangerous of human illusions.'
'There will no longer exist any individual arbitrary will, nor realms in which the individual belongs to himself.
column2: The time of happiness as a private matter is over.' Adolf Hitler

column1: 'A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.'
'Politics is history in the making.'
'A leader leads by example, not by force.'
'Let your plans be as dark and impenetrable as night, and when you move, fall like a thunderbolt.'
'Anyone who truly wants to go to war has truly never been there before.'
'We want this people to be hard, not soft, and you must steel yourselves for it in your youth!'
'It is not the State that orders us, but it is we who order the State!'
'We can safely make one prophecy: whatever the outcome of this war, the British Empire is at an end. It has been mortally wounded.'
'The purpose of war is to support your government's decisions by force.'
'A war is not lost until you consider it lost.'
'We should have known better after the first war.'
'War never ends, it only pales, reddens, blackens, and lightens again.'
'History does not long entrust the care of freedom to the weak, or the timid.'
'I have never liked France or the French, and I have never stopped saying so.'
'In war, the morale is to the material as three is to one.'
'I have been Europe's last hope. She proved incapable of refashioning herself by means of voluntary reform. To take her I had to use violence.'
'Sweat saves blood, blood saves lives, brain save both.'
'You only have to kick in the door and the whole rotten structure will come crashing down.'
column2: Adolf Hitler on invading the Soviet Union

column1: 'Gentlemen, you are about to witness the most famous victory in history.'
column2: Adolf Hitler addressing his generals on May 9th 1940

column1: 'Let us have a dagger between our teeth, a bomb in our hands and an infinite scorn in our hearts.'
'The truth is that men are tired of liberty.'
'Blood alone moves the wheels of history.'
'Wipe out the entire defense potential remaining to the Soviets.'
column2: Directive 41 issued to German Army generals

column1: 'Dunkirk has fallen...with it has ended the greatest battle of world history. Soldiers! You have not disappointed me.'
'The leader is always alone before bad fates.'
'A victory at Kursk would shine like a beacon to the world!'
'I fear all we have done is to awaken a sleeping giant and fill him with a terrible resolve.'
'If the tanks succeed, then victory follows.'
'Politics is war without bloodshed, while war is politics with bloodshed.'
'The more people you kill, the more revolutionary you are. '
'The Mediterranean will be turned into an Italian lake.'
'Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men.'
'Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do, and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.'
'Don't fight a battle if you don't gain anything by winning.'
'With stout hearts, and with enthusiasm for the contest, let us go forward to victory.'
'No revolution is worth anything unless it can defend itself.'
'To every man of us, Tobruk was a symbol of British resistance and we were now going to finish with it for good.'
'Oppression is the essence of power.'
'We learn from history that we learn nothing from history.'
'The enemy must be annihilated before he reaches our main battlefield. We must stop him in the water, destroying all his equipment while it is still afloat!'
'History repeats itself, first as tragedy, second as farce.'
'History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.'
'The Soviet Union, as everybody who has the courage to face the fact knows, is run by a dictatorship as absolute as any other dictatorship in the world.'
'I say that the delivery of needed supplies to Britain is imperative. I say that this can be done, it must be done, and it will be done.'
'On this tenth day of June 1940, the hand that held the dagger has struck it into the back of its neighbor.'
column2: Franklin Delano Roosevelt, in reference to Benito Mussolini

column1: 'The Russian Colossus has been underestimated by us. Whenever a dozen divisions are destroyed the Russians replace them with another dozen.'
column2: German Army General Chief of Staff Franz Haldervon Armin

column1: 'Singapore could only be taken after a siege by an army of at least 50,000 men. It is not considered possible that the Japanese would embark on such a mad enterprise.'
'The object of war is not to die for your country but to make the other bastard die for his.'
'When you get to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on.'
'The Chinese soldier was tough, brave, and experienced. After all he had been fighting on his own without help for years. He was a veteran among the Allies.'
'The death of one man is a tragedy. The death of millions is a statistic.'
'Death solves all problems - no man, no problem.'
'In the Soviet army it takes more courage to retreat than advance.'
'If the opposition disarms, well and good. If it refuses to disarm, we shall disarm it ourselves.'
'We happy few, we band of brothers. For he today that sheds his blood with me shall be my brother.'
'Ours is a world of nuclear giants and ethical infants. We know more about war than we know about peace, more
column2: about killing than we know about living.' Omar Bradley

column1: 'Battles are won by slaughter and maneuver. The greater the general, the more he contributes in maneuver, the less he demands in slaughter.'
'We shall defend our island, whatever the cost may be. We shall fight on the beaches, we shall fight on the landing grounds.
column2: We shall fight in the fields and in the streets. We shall fight in the hills. We shall never surrender!' Sir Winston Churchill

column1: 'Good night, then. Sleep to gather strength for the morning. For the morning will come.'
column2: Winston Churchill to the people of France, October 1940

column1: 'Before Alamein, we had no victories. After Alamein, we had no defeats.'
'In Hitler's launching of the Nazi campaign on Russia, we can already see, after six months of fighting, that he has made one of the outstanding blunders in history.'
'It is part of the general pattern of misguided policy that our country is now geared to an arms economy which was bred in an
column2: artificially induced psychosis of war hysteria and nurtured upon an incessant propaganda of fear.' General Douglas MacArthur, 15 May 1951

column1: 'We have taken a grave and hazardous decision to sustain the Greeks and try to make a Balkan Front.'
'To walk through the ruined cities of Germany is to feel an actual doubt about the continuity of civilization.'
'The Battle of France is over. The Battle of Britain is about to begin. Upon this battle depends the future of Christian civilization.'
'War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength.'
'War is war. The only good human being is a dead one.'
'The whole of northern Norway was covered with snow to depths which none of our soldiers had ever seen, felt, or imagined. Thus began this ramshackle campaign.'
'Greater Germany - the dream of our fathers and grandfathers - is finally created.'
column2: German Armaments Magnate Gustav Krupp von Bohlen

column1: 'If it moves, salute it. If it doesn't move, pick it up. And if you can't pick it up, paint it.'
'They sowed the wind, and now they are going to reap the whirlwind.'
'This is not a peace. It is an armistice for twenty years.'
'We in Poland do not know the concept of peace at any price. There is only one thing in the lives of men, nations and
column2: countries that is without price. That thing is honour!' Jozef Beck, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Poland, 5th May 1939

column1: 'To be defeated and not submit, is victory. To be victorious and rest on one's laurels, is defeat.'
'Better to live a day as a lion than 100 years as a sheep.'
'A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.'
'It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died. Rather we should thank God that such men lived.'
'Nobody ever defended anything successfully, there is only attack and attack and attack some more.'
'Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.'
'We herd sheep, we drive cattle, we lead people. Lead me, follow me, or get out of my way.'
'Don't let the bastards grind you down.'
'You can't have an air raid without bombs!'
'Any competent officer can command a Panzer Division, it takes a genius to supply one.'
'History shows that there are no invincible armies.'
'Education is dangerous - Every educated person is a future enemy.'
'I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.'
'Soldiers usually win the battles and generals get the credit for them.'
'Fuhrer, we are on the march! Victorious Italian troops crossed the Greco-Albanian frontier at dawn today!'
'Among the men who fought on Iwo Jima, uncommon valor was a common virtue.'
column2: Fleet Admiral Chester W. Nimitz, 16th March 1945

column1: 'Attacks on cities are strategically justified in so far as they tend to shorten the war and so preserve the lives of allied soldiers.'
column2: Air Chief Marshal Sir Arthur 'Bomber' Harris, 29th March 1945

column1: 'It is on this beautiful day that we celebrate the Fuhrer's birthday and thank him for he is the only reason why Germany is still alive today.'
column2: Josef Goebbels, Minister of Propaganda, 20th April 1945

column1: 'Technological progress is like an axe in the hands of a pathological criminal.'
'If we come to a minefield, our infantry attacks exactly as it were not there.'
'Commit all of your atrocities at once.'
'Optimistic officers learn English and pessimists Russian.'
'What is best in life? To crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and to hear the lamentation of their women!'
'I can't listen to that much Wagner. I start getting the urge to conquer Poland.'
'Some goddamn fool once said that flanks have got to be secure. Since then son of a bitches all over the globe have been guarding their flanks.'
'The fiercest serpent may be overcome by a swarm of ants.'
'I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat.'
'The only thing that we have to fear is fear itself.'
'You hit somebody with your fist and not with your fingers spread.'
'We may be destroyed, but if we are, we shall drag a world with us - a WORLD IN FLAMES.'
'Success is not final, failure is not fatal. It is the courage to continue that counts.'
'There never was a good war or a bad peace.'
'Si vis pacem, para bellum (If you want peace, prepare for war).'
'Patriots always talk of dying for their country and never of killing for their country.'
'He who fears being conquered is sure of defeat.'
'Today we rule Germany, tomorrow, the world.'
'We no longer demand anything, we want war.'
'If you are going through hell...keep going.'
'No compromise is possible and the victory of the democracies can only be complete with the utter defeat of the war machines of Germany and Japan.'
'Air superiority is a condition for all operations, at sea, in land, and in the air.'
'The world must know what happened, and never forget.'
column2: Dwight Eisenhower, visiting Nazi death camps, 1945

column1: 'Everyone's a pacifist between wars.  It's like being a vegetarian between meals.'
'France has lost a battle, but France has not lost the war.'
'We must be the great arsenal of democracy.'
'I have said this before, but I shall say it again and again: your boys are not going to be sent into any foreign wars.'
'Yesterday, December 7, 1941, "a date which will live in infamy", the United States of America was suddenly and deliberately attacked by naval and air forces of the Empire of Japan.'
'I think war might be God's way of teaching us geography.'
'Man has no right to kill his brother.  It is no excuse that he does so in uniform : he only adds the infamy of servitude to the crime of murder.'
'Anyone who has ever looked into the glazed eyes of a soldier dying on the battlefield will think hard before starting a war.'
'Wars usually have the effect of speeding up the process of history.'
'War is not an adventure. It is a disease. It is like typhus.'
'The Duce will have Ethiopia... with or without Ethiopians.'
'An enemy forgiven is more dangerous than a thousand foes.'
'Democracy is beautiful in theory, in practice it is a fallacy. You in America will see that some day.'
'When I saw a very strong light, a flash, I put my arms over my face unconsciously... The whole city was destroyed and burning. There was no place to go.'
column2: A survivor of the atomic bombing of Hiroshima

column1: 'You think of the lives which would have been lost in an invasion of Japan's main islands and you thank God for the atomic bomb.'
'The engine of the Panzer is just as much a weapon as the main-gun.'
'We have severely underestimated the Russians, the extent of the country and the treachery of the climate. This is the revenge of reality.'
'This is the second time in our history that there has come back from Germany to Downing Street peace with honour. I believe it is peace in our time.'
'Eat less wheat, meat, sugar and fats to save for the army and our allies.'
'As world capital Berlin will only be comparable with Ancient Egypt, Babylon, and Rome! What is London, what is Paris compared to that!'
'It is increasingly clear that we underestimated the Russian colossus. Their forces are not always well-armed and equipped and they are often poorly led. But they are there.'
'From now on, Russian resistance will be minor. All we have to do is keep rolling forward. Our duty has been to fight and free the world from this communist disease.
column2: One day, the world will thank the Germans and our beloved Fuhrer for our victories here in Russia.' Karl Fuchs, Panzer Gunner, October 15th 1941

column1: 'Perhaps it is only 'talk' that the enemy is broken and will never rise again. Will the whole war really be over by winter?'
'The offensive combat power of the Corps HAS RAN OUT. Reasons: physical and moral over-exertion, loss of a large number of commanders, inadequate winter equipment.
column2: The High Command should decide whether a withdrawal should be undertaken.' Erich Hoepner, Fourth Panzer Group commander, December 3rd 1941

column1: 'The German Army in fighting Russia is like an elephant attacking a host of ants. The elephant will kill thousands, perhaps even millions, of ants, but in the end
column2: their numbers will overcome him, and he will be eaten to the bone.' Colonel Bernd Von Kielst

column1: 'We were faced with a choice between two dictators. We preferred the one who spoke Russian.'
column2: A senior Soviet officer when asked why he fought for Stalin

column1: 'When you see a green plane, it's American. When you see a brown plane, it's British. When you see no planes at all, then it's the Luftwaffe!
column2: In his infinite wisdom, our beloved Fuhrer has painted our aircraft with invisible paint.' German joke at the end of the war

column1: 'A teacher in Germany asked a student to give an example of a 'paradox'. The pupil replied, 'When the second man of the Third Reich runs away first.'
'Why are the streets of Paris lined with trees? So the German Army doesn't get sunburned during its victory parades.'
'Sometimes it is tougher to fight my superiors than the French.'
'Chamberlain takes a weekend in the country, while Hitler takes a country in a weekend.'
'I am going to die here, 21 years old, in the snows before Moscow.'
column2: A German soldier, reacting to a Soviet attack on December 5th 1941

column1: 'My tunic and trousers are stiff as cardboard with mud and blood... The corpse near me stinks unbearably...
column2: One sees body parts trampled in the mud... We walk on them.' Red Army soldier Nikolai Nikulin, August 18th 1942

column1: 'We had ceased to be an army, I was no longer with soldiers but with creatures incapable of controlling themselves,
column2: obedient to a single animal instinct: self-preservation.' Italian lieutenant Eugenio Corti, January 1943

column1: 'This is what Germans are meant to look like -- tall like Goebbels, slim like Goering, and blonde like Hitler!'
